security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based analysis skill with minimal tool access. The skill reads files only in user-specified directories, runs a simple Python pattern detection script that only reads and outputs text, and does not access network, environment variables, or sensitive system areas. All capabilities are appropriate for code pattern analysis.

content.value_statement: Understanding code structure and patterns helps developers navigate unfamiliar codebases faster. This skill identifies design patterns, architectural styles, and recurring code structures to provide insights into how software is organized.
actual_capabilities: Identify Gang of Four and modern design patterns in code
Recognize architectural patterns like MVC, layered, and microservices
Detect code repetition and duplication across files
Extract naming conventions and organization strategies
limitations: Pattern detection uses signature matching; may miss custom implementations
Cannot execute code or perform runtime analysis
Analysis quality depends on code clarity and naming conventions

use_cases.title: Understand project structure
use_cases.description: Quickly grasp how a new codebase is organized by identifying architectural patterns and design choices.

use_cases.title: Find code duplication
use_cases.description: Identify repeated code blocks and patterns that could be extracted into shared utilities.

use_cases.title: Assess design quality
use_cases.description: Evaluate whether patterns are correctly implemented and appropriate for the problem domain.

prompt_templates.title: Find design patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: What design patterns are used in this codebase? Look for Factory, Singleton, Observer, and Strategy patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the application architecture. What pattern is used? Describe the directory structure and layer organization.

prompt_templates.title: Find duplication
prompt_templates.prompt: Find duplicate or similar code blocks in this codebase. List the files and explain what can be refactored.

prompt_templates.title: Anti-pattern check
prompt_templates.prompt: Identify anti-patterns in this codebase. Look for God Objects, magic numbers, and tight coupling.

output_examples.input: What design patterns are used in this codebase?
output: ‚Ä¢ Repository Pattern: src/repositories/*.ts for data access
‚Ä¢ Strategy Pattern: src/utils/strategies/*.ts for interchangeable algorithms

best_practices: Provide file paths and line numbers for all pattern discoveries
Distinguish between patterns used correctly versus anti-patterns
Suggest refactoring only when it improves maintainability
anti_patterns: Recommending pattern application where simpler code suffices
Missing context-specific adaptations of standard patterns
Focusing on pattern names rather than code quality impact

faq.question: What languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Java, Go, and Rust with pattern signatures for each.

faq.question: How accurate is pattern detection?
faq.answer: Detection uses code signatures; it may miss unconventional implementations but catches standard patterns.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reads files and provides analysis. It does not write or modify any code.

faq.question: Does this skill send data externally?
faq.answer: No. All analysis happens locally. No network calls are made during pattern detection.

faq.question: Why were some patterns not detected?
faq.answer: Patterns may not be detected if they use non-standard naming, are implemented without typical signatures, or span multiple files in unusual ways.

faq.question: How is this different from a linter?
faq.answer: Linters check code style and errors. This skill identifies architectural patterns and design structures that require semantic understanding.
